Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

I recently asked about C# and Java versions of NEAT.

I downloaded Ugo Vierucci's JNEAT code, got it working and started having a
nose through the source - it's a bit of a mess and difficult to follow or
adapt because of that. So i thought i'd take a crack at refactoring it a
little and that little has ended up being a complete re-write. I've given it
the rather imaginative title of JNEAT2 - but this'll probably change when
the right name suggests itself.

I'm not finished yet but thought i'd just post as i've been really enjoying
this project and hopefully others will find it useful once i'm done.

Basically i've:


   - Seperated the core NEAT classes from the UI and the loading mechanism -
   There's a nice easy way of creating new UI's to view the evolution/winners
   etc. etc. now.
   - All the properties are loaded via Spring's IOC container - so
   everything is in easy-to-read xml or properties files.
   - Experiments are created as JAR files - with all the spring context
   files defining the experiment's parameters/genomes/training data etc and
   compiled .class files inside - these are loaded by JNEAT2 and the experiment
   can be executed - the settings can be adjusted and the experiment re-run or
   saved back out as a new JAR file so experiments can easily be transferred.


I'm a Flash/Flex developer primarily so my interest in abstracting the UI
elements is so i can build a Flex client for this Java 'back-end' - this way
i can have a web-based interface for experiments.

This is purely a personal project at the moment - so i plan on releasing the
finished code as an open-source project and developing some experiments with
it once i've got things working.

I'll keep the list updated with my progress and if anyone has any
comments/suggestions/requests feel free to drop me a line.

Regards

-- 
Trevor Burton
http://www.flashmonkey.org
http://www.infrared5.com

--0003255597feedb38e047ac83b30
